newsitem.title: UK: BBC radio transmission co privatised - 3i.
newsitem.headline: BBC radio transmission co privatised - 3i.

text.p: The British Broadcasting Corp's World Service radio transmission company was privatised in a management-employee buyout for 21.2 million stg, British investment firm 3i Group Plc said on Thursday.
The firm said it provided 12.9 million stg of financing for the buyout of the company, which transmits BBC World Service Radio programmes worldwide.
The new company will be called Merlin Communications International Ltd.
The purchase price included 15.3 million stg of debt financing from HSBC Holdings's Midland Bank and HSBC Investment Bank.
Under the deal, Merlin will have a 10-year contract to transmit radio programmes produced by the BBC to an international audience. --London Newsroom +44 171 542 7717
